trans-unit.source: Debugging your Service Fabric Application in Visual Studio using F5
trans-unit.target: Debugging your Service Fabric Application in Visual Studio using F5

trans-unit.source: Improve the reliability and performance of your services using Visual Studio and a local development cluster.
trans-unit.target: Improve the reliability and performance of your services using Visual Studio and a local development cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can save time and money by deploying and debugging your Service Fabric application in a local computer development cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can save time and money by deploying and debugging your Service Fabric application in a local computer development cluster.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio can deploy the application to the local cluster and automatically connect the debugger to all instances of your application.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio can deploy the application to the local cluster and automatically connect the debugger to all instances of your application.

trans-unit.source: Start a local development cluster by following the steps in <linkText>setting up your Service Fabric development environment</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Start a local development cluster by following the steps in <linkText>setting up your Service Fabric development environment</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Press F5 or click Debug > Start Debugging
trans-unit.target: Press F5 or click Debug > Start Debugging

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Start debugging an application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Start debugging an application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Set breakpoints in your code and step through the application by clicking on commands in the Debug menu.
trans-unit.target: Set breakpoints in your code and step through the application by clicking on commands in the Debug menu.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio attaches to all instances of your application.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio attaches to all instances of your application.

trans-unit.source: While stepping through code, breakpoints may get hit by multiple processes resulting in concurrent sessions.
trans-unit.target: While stepping through code, breakpoints may get hit by multiple processes resulting in concurrent sessions.

trans-unit.source: Try disabling the breakpoint(s) after being hit, making the breakpoint conditional on the thread ID, or using Diagnostic Events.
trans-unit.target: Try disabling the breakpoint(s) after being hit, making the breakpoint conditional on the thread ID, or using Diagnostic Events.

trans-unit.source: The Diagnostic Events window will automatically open to view diagnostic events in real time.
trans-unit.target: The Diagnostic Events window will automatically open to view diagnostic events in real time.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>View diagnostic events in real time</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>View diagnostic events in real time</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can also open the Diagnostic Events window in the Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You can also open the Diagnostic Events window in the Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Under Azure, right click on Service Fabric Cluster > View Diagnostic Events...
trans-unit.target: Under Azure, right click on Service Fabric Cluster > View Diagnostic Events...

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open the diagnostic events window</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open the diagnostic events window</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The diagnostic events can be seen in the automatically generated ServiceEventSource.cs and are called from application code.
trans-unit.target: The diagnostic events can be seen in the automatically generated ServiceEventSource.cs and are called from application code.

trans-unit.source: The Diagnostic Events window supports filtering, pausing, and inspecting events in real time.
trans-unit.target: The Diagnostic Events window supports filtering, pausing, and inspecting events in real time.

trans-unit.source: The filter is a simple string search of the event message, including its contents.
trans-unit.target: The filter is a simple string search of the event message, including its contents.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Filter, pause and resume, or inspect events in real time</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Filter, pause and resume, or inspect events in real time</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Debugging services is similar to debugging any other application.
trans-unit.target: Debugging services is similar to debugging any other application.

trans-unit.source: Breakpoints can be set normally through Visual Studio for easy debugging.
trans-unit.target: Breakpoints can be set normally through Visual Studio for easy debugging.

trans-unit.source: Even though Reliable Collections are replicated across multiple nodes, they still implement IEnumerable, which means you can use the Results View in Visual Studio while debugging to see what you've stored inside.
trans-unit.target: Even though Reliable Collections are replicated across multiple nodes, they still implement IEnumerable, which means you can use the Results View in Visual Studio while debugging to see what you've stored inside.

trans-unit.source: Simply set a break point anywhere in your code.
trans-unit.target: Simply set a break point anywhere in your code.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Start debugging an application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Start debugging an application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Test a Service Fabric service</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Test a Service Fabric service</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Managing your Service Fabric applications in Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Managing your Service Fabric applications in Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.
